|-|Common = {{Infobox item |name = Gale Leg Frame |image = XC3 Accessory Boot.png |caption = Boosts damage dealt by 35% for the first 30 seconds of battle. |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Common |source = |sell = 7740 [[Gold|G]] }} |-|Rare = {{Infobox item |name = Gale Leg Frame |image = XC3 Accessory Boot.png |caption = Boosts damage dealt by 40% for the first 30 seconds of battle. |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Rare |source = |sell = 7740 [[Gold|G]] }} |-|Legendary = {{Infobox item |name = Gale Leg Frame |image = XC3 Accessory Boot.png |caption = Boosts damage dealt by 45% for the first 30 seconds of battle. |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Legendary |source = |sell = 7740 [[Gold|G]] }}
'''Gale Leg Frames''' are [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessories]] in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}. {{clr}} {{xc3 stub}} {{fr stub}} [[Category:XC3 Accessories]] [[Category:XC3FR Accessories]]

[[file:Supercharged Alfonso.png|thumb|150px|Supercharged Alfonso]] '''Garaffas''' are a family of enemies in the {{XC|serieslink}}. They resemble giraffe and catfish hybrid creatures, and come in red and green varieties.
== {{XC2|-}} == In {{XC2}}, green Garaffas are found in grassy areas such as [[Gormott Province]], whilst red Garaffas are only found in the [[Kingdom of Uraya]]. === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Glaw Garaffa]] * [[Mailoo Garaffa (XC2)|Mailoo Garaffa]]
=== Unique Monster === * [[Supercharged Alfonso]]
=== Challenge Battle Mode Enemy === * [[Burgill Garaffa]]
== {{TTGC|-}} == === Normal Minor Enemy === * [[Marna Garaffa]]
== {{XC3|-}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Cuyask Garaffa]] * [[Mailoo Garaffa (XC3)|Mailoo Garaffa]] * [[Rasheen Garaffa]] * [[Segaro Garaffa]]
=== Quest Exclusive Enemy === * [[Kaalm Garaffa]] (During ''[[Third Day of Prison]]'')
=== Unique Monster === * [[Sundappled Floria]]
== {{XC3FR|sub}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Cuyask Garaffa]] * [[Dark Garaffa]] ([[Fogbeast]]) * [[Rasheen Garaffa]] * [[Segaro Garaffa]] * [[Shadow Garaffa]] (Fogbeast)
=== Unique Monster === * [[Fogtrawler Tallstuff]] (Fogbeast)
== Gallery == === {{XC2|-}} === <gallery> XC2 Mailoo Garaffa.png|Mailoo Garaffa Burgill Garaffa.jpg|Burgill Garaffa GlawGaraffa.jpg|Glaw Garaffa </gallery>
=== {{TTGC|-}} === <gallery> MarnaGaraffa.jpg|Marna Garaffa </gallery>
=== {{XC3|-}} === <gallery> Mailoo Garaffa.jpg|Mailoo Garaffa XC3 Sundappled Floria.png|Sundappled Floria </gallery>

{{for|the Accessory in {{XC2|-}}|Garnet (XC2)}}
|-|Common = {{Infobox item |name = Garnet |image = XC3 Accessory Ring.png |caption = Boosts damage by 10% for every enemy in battle (max. 200%). |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Common |source = |sell = 2110 [[Gold|G]] }} |-|Rare = {{Infobox item |name = Garnet |image = XC3 Accessory Ring.png |caption = Boosts damage by 11% for every enemy in battle (max. 200%). |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Rare |source = |sell = 2110 [[Gold|G]] }} |-|Legendary = {{Infobox item |name = Garnet |image = XC3 Accessory Ring.png |caption = Boosts damage by 12% for every enemy in battle (max. 200%). |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Legendary |source = |sell = 2110 [[Gold|G]] }}
'''Garnets''' are [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessories]] in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}. {{clr}} {{xc3 stub}} {{fr stub}} [[Category:XC3 Accessories]] [[Category:XC3FR Accessories]]

{{spoiler}} {{Infobox Character |name = Garvel |image = Garvel.png |species = [[Keves]]i human |age = 2nd Term |gender = Male |haircolor = Silver |eyecolor = Blue |affiliation = [[Colony 14]] (formerly)
[[Colony 8]] (formerly)
[[H's Colony]] (formerly)
[[Colony 4]] |voiceactorjp = [[wikipedia:Gakuto Kajiwara|Gakuto Kajiwara]] |voiceactoreng= [[wikipedia:Brenock O'Connor|Brenock O'Connor]] |appearances = {{XC3}} }} '''Garvel''' (Japanese: {{lang|jp|ゲセル}}, ''Gesell'') is a character in {{XC3}}. == Overview == Garvel was a childhood rival of [[Noah]] and his friends at [[Colony 14]], his squad was composed of [[Kite]], [[Hoope]] and [[Layla]]. He died during the war with [[Agnus]] after moving to [[Colony 8]], and was later reborn as a soldier of [[H's Colony]] alongside Hoope and Layla. After [[Lanz]] and the party defeat [[Consul]] [[H]], he is freed from the control of her Colony's [[Flame Clock]] and is sent to [[Colony 4]] before being transferred to [[Colony 9 (XC3)|Colony 9]]. {{clr}} == Battle == {{Infobox Enemy |name = Garvel |image = Team Garvel.png |caption = Garvel (Center) |category = [[Quest Exclusive Enemy (XC3)|Quest Exclusive]] [[Boss (XC3)|Boss]] |type = [[Keves Forces]] |level = 47 |area = [[Great Sword's Base]] ([[Cradle Convoy Shelter]]) |spawntime = During ''[[Side Story: Lanz]]'' |respawn = No |movement = |detection = |exp = |cp = |sp = }} '''Garvel''' is a [[Quest Exclusive Enemy (XC3)|Quest Exclusive]] [[Boss (XC3)|Boss]]. He is a [[Keves Forces|Keves Soldier]] who is fought at level 47 at the [[Cradle Convoy Shelter]] at the [[Great Sword's Base]] during ''[[Side Story: Lanz]]''. {{clr}} == Quotes == * ''"Don't underestimate the elite!"'' * ''"Elite! That's me!"'' * ''"GET IT RIGHT!"'' * ''"Have some!"'' * ''"Snuff this!"'' * ''"Hoope, your aim sucks!"'' * ''"You're our shield, Layla! Act like it!"'' * ''"Retreat?! NEVER!"'' == Gallery == === Artwork === Garvel Crys Concept Art.png|Garvel's Concept Art === In-Game Renders === XC3 Garvel Icon.png|Garvel's Affinity chart icon {{XC3CharNav}} {{xc3 stub}} [[Category:XC3 Supporting Characters]] [[Category:Fornis Region NPCs]] [[Category:Aetia Region NPCs]] [[Category:XC3 Kevesi]] [[Category:Cadensia Region Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Bosses]] [[Category:XC3 Quest Exclusive Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Quest Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Level 46-50 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Keves Forces]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing stats]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing drops]] [[Category:Pages needing plot info]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Gastrates |image = Gastrates.jpg |caption = Gastrates |category = Minor Enemy |type = [[Levnis]] |level = 38-39
66-67 |area = [[Syra Hovering Reefs]]
[[Erythia Sea]] ([[Lavi Sandbar]]) |spawntime = Anytime |respawn = Yes |movement = |detection = |exp = |cp = |sp = }} '''Gastrates''' are minor enemies in {{XC3}}. They are [[Keves]]i [[Levnis]]es, and can be found at level 38-39 near the south entrance to [[Keves Castle]] in the [[Syra Hovering Reefs]], near [[Protector Revelta]]. They can also be found at level 66-67 on the south-eastern side of [[Lavi Sandbar]] in [[Erythia Sea]]. [[Valdi]]'s Levnis project [[Dorrick]] is a type of Gastrates Levnis. {{clr}} {{xc3 stub}} [[Category:XC3 Minor Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Levnises]] [[Category:Cadensia Region Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Level 36-40 Enemies]] [[Category:Keves Castle Region Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Level 66-70 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Bosses]] [[Category:XC3 Quest Exclusive Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Quest Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Challenge Battle Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing stats]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing drops]]

|-|Common = {{Infobox item |name = Gear Support |image = XC3 Accessory Shirt.png |caption = Boosts Agility by 20%. |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Common |source = |sell = 2330 [[Gold|G]] }} |-|Rare = {{Infobox item |name = Gear Support |image = XC3 Accessory Shirt.png |caption = Boosts Agility by 21%. |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Rare |source = |sell = 2330 [[Gold|G]] }} |-|Legendary = {{Infobox item |name = Gear Support |image = XC3 Accessory Shirt.png |caption = Boosts Agility by 22%. |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Legendary |source = |sell = 2330 [[Gold|G]] }}
'''Gear Supports''' are [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessories]] in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}. {{clr}} {{xc3 stub}} {{fr stub}} [[Category:XC3 Accessories]] [[Category:XC3FR Accessories]]

{{spoiler}} [[File:Gem crafting.jpg|thumb|300px|[[Shulk]] and [[Reyn]] crafting a gem]] '''Gem Crafting''' (Japanese: {{lang|ja|ジェムクラフト}}, ''Jemu kurafuto'') is a mechanic in {{XC}} and {{XC3}}. == {{XC|-}} == Gem Crafting in {{XC|-}} can be done with different [[ether]] [[Ether Crystal (XC1)|crystals]] found by killing monsters or [[mining]] from Ether Crystal deposits and [[Ether Cylinder (Gem Crafting)|Ether Cylinders]] created as a byproduct when creating [[gem]]s. Each of these components can have several different qualities with varying strength, such as [[Strength Up]] 80, [[Agility Up]] 15 or [[Night Vision (XC1)|Night Vision]] 28%. Each Gem has a range that the Gem's quality will fall under. For example, Strength Up I will increase strength by between 5-10. Meanwhile, Strength Up II will increase strength by between 15-20. The exact quality value within the range is completely randomised, and the Gem Crafting process has no effect on it. In {{XCFC|sublink}}, gems are not crafted but mined directly from the high-quality Ether deposits on [[Bionis' Shoulder]]. === Creating gems === The process of gem crafting requires different components to be selected until one or more of the collective qualities of the components selected exceeds 100%, or it is also possible to start crafting with only two components which do not give a quality with a strength over 100%. Two party members are chosen to operate the gem crafting furnace. They have different qualities depending on which position they take, as "Shooter" or "Engineer". Each character's Shooter and Engineer ability is unique. The [[Affinity (XC1)#Playable Character's Affinity|affinity]] between the characters affects how many cycles they spend crafting, giving better chances for higher level gems. High affinity characters not participating may give a party boost to the team. Crafters may go into a fever where they raise the strength even higher. ==== Flames ==== There are three types of flames. Each time the Shooter "shoots" into the furnace, the [[#Engineer properties|Engineers' abilities]] affect the type of flame that occurs: {| class="xc1 centered" ! style="width: 90px" |Flame ! style="width: 60px" |Colour ! style="width: 150px" |Effect |- | style="color:red" | Strong Flame |Red |Raise one quality a lot
(between 3 and 11) ※1 |- | style="color:blue" | Medium Flame |Blue |Raise all qualities a bit
(between 1 and 6) ※2 |- | style="color:green" | Gentle Flame |Green |Raise cylinder gauge
(between 30% and 70%) ※3 |} :※1: A random number between 1 and 6 is added if Reyn is the [[#Shooter properties|Shooter]]. :※2: A random number between 1 and 6 is added if Melia is the [[#Shooter properties|Shooter]]. :※3: 25% is added if Sharla is the [[#Shooter properties|Shooter]]. ==== Cylinder Gauge ==== The Cylinder Gauge is represented by the vertical strip between the characters and the table. Each time a cylinder gauge fills up to 100%, the number above the strip will increase by one, and the Cylinder Gauge will reset to represent the gauge for the next cylinder. After the crafting process is over, the maximum number of cylinders that can be received is represented by the number above the Cylinder Gauge. The player can choose which ones to keep. The rest of the cylinders will be discarded. In order to increase the maximum number of cylinders, each character's Shooter and Engineer properties must be examined to find the pair who will fill the gauge the most. === Heat and Mega Heat === When crafting, if a quality's strength exceeds 100% it will become a gem. If the strength exceeds 200% it receives "Heat" status and the resultant gem becomes one grade higher than its components. Furthermore, if the value of one quality goes above 300% it receives "Mega Heat" status, in which case two full-strength gems are acquired for that quality, instead of just one. Any qualities with strengths below 100% can become a cylinder for crafting another time. The number of cylinders created after a successful crafting round is determined by the cylinder count (which is raised by gentle flames). When seeking to make the highest-strength gems possible, it is often desirable to fall just short of actually creating a gem — instead creating refined cylinders for the target property with strength as close to 99% as possible; in this way, it is much easier to achieve "Heat" and "Mega Heat" status. === Shooter and Engineer Abilities === Each character has a unique Shooter quality with a particular effect property. They have also a unique Engineer qualities combination for each Flame type. The choice of the Shooter and Engineer duo amongst the seven characters leads to different results. For example, the best choice to increase the purity of a single gem in order to reach the "Mega Heat" status is [[Shulk]] as the Shooter, raising the Fever probability rate, and [[Reyn]] as the Engineer, owning a Great ability for Strong Flame that raises one quality a lot. ==== Shooter properties ==== {| class="xc1 centered sortable" style="width:100%" |- ! Character ! Quality ! Effect |- |[[Shulk]] |Fever Plus |Gets into a Fever easily when crafting.
''(+1% Fever chance)'' |- |[[Reyn]] |Strong Bonus |Qualities grow stronger with a strong flame.
''(Strong flames give +1~6)'' |- |[[Sharla]] |Gentle Bonus |Cylinder Gauge fills up more with gentle flame.
''(Gentle flames give +25% cylinder gauge)'' |- |[[Dunban]] |Combo Master |Qualities grow stronger when flame is constant.
''(Strong or Medium flames give +2, and then an additional +1 per combo)'' |- |[[Melia]] |Medium Bonus |Qualities grow stronger with a medium flame.
''(Medium flames give +1~6)'' |- |[[Riki]] |Impatient Shooter |Gem crafting process happens twice in a row. ※
''(Each flame shoots twice, but cannot enter Fever)'' |- |[[Fiora]] |Cylinder Plus |Crafting begins with 3 full cylinder gauges. |} :※ A bug in the original version of {{XC|-}} means that Riki's Shooter ability does not work properly, and he will only shoot up to a maximum of 15 times. In {{XCDE|sub}}, the bug has been fixed, and Riki now works properly - at the cost of not being able to enter a Fever, he shoots twice as much. This means that he is much more viable for gem crafting than previously (a blue affinity Riki and Reyn being on par with a max affinity Shulk and Reyn). ==== Engineer properties ==== {| class="xc1 centered sortable" style="width:100%" |- ! Character ! Strong Flame ! Medium Flame ! Gentle Flame |- |[[Shulk]] | style="background-color: #ccf;" |Average (25%) | style="background-color: #ccf;" |Average (25%) | style="background-color: #cfc;" |Good (50%) |- |[[Reyn]] | style="background-color: #7f7;" |Great (80%) | style="background-color: #fcc;" |Poor (10%) | style="background-color: #fcc;" |Poor (10%) |- |[[Sharla]] | style="background-color: #fcc;" |Poor (15%) | style="background-color: #cfc;" |Good (60%) | style="background-color: #ccf;" |Average (25%) |- |[[Dunban]] | style="background-color: #cfc;" |Good (60%) | style="background-color: #fcc;" |Poor (15%) | style="background-color: #ccf;" |Average (25%) |- |[[Melia]] | style="background-color: #fcc;" |Poor (10%) | style="background-color: #7f7;" |Great (80%) | style="background-color: #fcc;" |Poor (10%) |- |[[Riki]] | style="background-color: #f77;" |Terrible (10%) | style="background-color: #f77;" |Terrible (10%) | style="background-color: #7f7;" |Great (80%) |- |[[Fiora]] | style="background-color: #f77;" |Terrible (5%) | style="background-color: #7f7;" |Great (90%) | style="background-color: #f77;" |Terrible (5%) |} === Mobile Furnace === The [[Gem Man]] in [[Colony 9 (XC1)|Colony 9]] will give the party a quest, ''[[The Gem Man's Invention]]'', in which he asks them to get an [[Ultra Small Reactor]] from [[Colony 6]]. The reactor can be obtained by upgrading all of Colony 6's levels to one. The Gem Man will then make the [[Mobile Furnace]] so that the party can craft gems whenever they want. === Calculation methods === ==== Turns and Fever ==== The exact number of turns is calculated as follows: : Minimum number of turns: (affinity + 250) / 750 + 3. : Maximum number of turns: affinity / 500 + 5. Affinity is determined by the numeric value of the affinity between the Shooter and the Engineer. Affinity can range from a minimum of 0 to a maximum of 5,000. Starting with the ''minimum number of turns'', there is a 80% chance for another turn to be added, with the limit being the ''maximum number of turns''. {| class="mw-collapsible mw-collapsed" | Pseudocode: |- | int affinity = ( affinityBetween(Shooter, Engineer) ) int minTurns = (affinity + 250) / 750 + 3 int maxTurns = affinity / 500 + 5 int turns for (turns = minTurns; turns < maxTurns; turns++)    if (Rand(100) >= 80)       break; return turns; |} Each time a turn is executed, there is a set percentage of chance for triggering a fever. The fever trigger percentage can be calculated as follows: :Base percentage: 1%.
:If Shulk is the Shooter (his [[#Shooter properties|shooter property]]): +1%.
  If the Shooter has Shulk's [[Skill Tree/Shulk#Intuition|Fever Pitch Skill]]: +1%. :If the Engineer has Shulk's Fever Pitch Skill: +1%. The minimum fever trigger percentage is 1%. The maximum percentage can reach up to 4%. Once a regular turn triggers a fever, a certain number of bonus fever turns are inserted. The minimum and maximum of this range is always the same. : Minimum number of fever bonus turns: 3. : Maximum number of fever bonus turns: 10. Starting with the ''minimum number of fever bonus turns'', there is a 70% chance for another fever bonus turn to be added, with the limit being the ''maximum number of fever bonus turns''. {| class="mw-collapsible mw-collapsed" | Pseudocode: |- | int minFeverTurns = 3 int maxFeverTurns = 10 for (int turns = minFeverTurns; turns < maxFeverTurns; turns++)    if (Rand(100) >= 70)       break; return turns; |} ==== Party Support ==== Party Support is dependent on the non-participating party member's support with the Crafting Engineer. Affinity is determined by the numeric value of the affinity between the aforementioned two characters. Affinity can range from a minimum of 0 to a maximum of 5,000. This numeric value will be referred to as affinity. For each turn, the algorithm goes through each non-participating character who hasn't given Party Support yet. This means that each character can only give Party Support once per crafting session. For every valid character, a random number between 0 and 10,000 is rolled. If this number is within the range of 0 and affinity, then that character's party support is triggered that turn. To increase the rate of triggering party support, the range must be increased by increasing the affinity between the two characters. This means that a maximum of 5,000 affinity provides a 50% chance of triggering Party Support each turn until it is triggered. When a Party Support is triggered, between 1 to 3 different qualities are chosen. Each of these qualities are increased by between 10 to 21 points. It is possible for a single quality to be chosen twice. {| class="mw-collapsible mw-collapsed" | Pseudocode: |- | for each turn    for each Character       if ( (Character is not crafting) and (Character has not triggered Party Support))          int affinity = affinityBetween(Character, Engineer)          int roll = rand(10,000)          if (roll < affinity)             Trigger Party Support    next Character next turn |} == {{XC3|-}} == At [[Rest Spot (XC3)|Rest Spots]], the party can craft Gems using items picked up while exploring or acquired from [[enemy (XC3)|enemies]]. Gems are powerful equipment that can be attached to each character, increasing attack power, recovery power, and other battle-enhancing effects.[https://twitter.com/XenobladeJP/status/1531170715864510464]. If the party does not have enough of the required items needed to craft a Gem, [[Nopon Coin (XC3)|Nopon Coins]] can be exchanged instead to craft a Gem without having to collect the required items. In {{XC3FR|sublink}}, Gems can only be crafted up to level V, with the ability to craft gems above level III being unlocked after completing ''[[The Derelict Ether Furnace]]''. Completing this quest also enables the party to craft gems using the [[Gem Man's Stall|ether furance]] outside of [[Colony 9 (XC1)|Colony 9]]'s [[Command Center]]. {| class="xc1 centered sortable" style="width:100%" |+ Nopon Coin Conversion Rate ! Gem Level !! Required Coins |- | I || [[File:Nopon Coin Gold.png|link=Nopon Coin (Gold)|38px]] x 1 |- | II || [[File:Nopon Coin Gold.png|link=Nopon Coin (Gold)|38px]] x 4 |- | III || [[File:Nopon Coin Gold.png|link=Nopon Coin (Gold)|38px]] x 8 |- | IV|| [[File:Nopon Coin Gold.png|link=Nopon Coin (Gold)|38px]] x 14 |- | V || [[File:Nopon Coin Gold.png|link=Nopon Coin (Gold)|38px]] x 20 |- | VI || [[File:Nopon Coin Gold.png|link=Nopon Coin (Gold)|38px]] x 28 |- | VII || [[File:Nopon Coin Gold.png|link=Nopon Coin (Gold)|38px]] x 40 |- | VIII || [[File:Nopon Coin Gold.png|link=Nopon Coin (Gold)|38px]] x 55 |- | IX || [[File:Nopon Coin Gold.png|link=Nopon Coin (Gold)|38px]] x 75 |- | X || [[File:Nopon Coin Gold.png|link=Nopon Coin (Gold)|38px]] x 99 |} {{clr}} == Gallery == === {{XC|-}} === Explorer img03 2.jpg|Shulk and Reyn crafting a gem in the ''Definitive Edition'' 5등급 광물 구하기.png|Korean list of level V ether crystal locations & monster drops === {{XC3|-}} === XC3 Gem Crafting 01.jpg XC3 Gem Crafting 02.jpg == External links == * [http://www.gamesradar.com/xenoblade-chronicles-beginners-guide/?page=8 A beginner's tutorial on gem crafting] == References == {{xc3 stub}} {{Fr stub}} [[Category:XC Mechanics]] [[Category:XC Gems]] [[Category:XC3 Mechanics]] [[Category:XC3 Gems]] [[Category:XC3FR Mechanics]] [[Category:XC3FR Gems]] [[Category:Crafting Mechanics]]
